trial_identification.studytitle: Mid-forehead thermometry in Neonatal Intensive Care.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Is Mid-forehead thermometry as accurate as digital axilla in all Neonates admitted to Neonatal Intensive Care Unit?

conditions.healthcondition: Temperature obtained from infra-red mid-forehead thermometry and digital axilla.

interventions.interventions: Infra-red mid-forehead thermometry. Measurements to be taken along with digital axilla control at 0800hours and 2000hours for three days. Approximate times only with cue based cares.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Comparison of mid-forehead thermometry readings and accuracy versus current thermometry used, digital axilla.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: On admission and twice daily for three days.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Perfusion measurements of foot with infra-red thermometer to assess how well neonates are.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: With mid-forehead measurements and digital axilla meausurements, twice daily for three days, (and on admission).

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: All admissions to Neonatal Intensive Care Unit at Dunedin Public Hospital.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Active cooling due to Hypoxic-Ischemic Encephalopathy, in extremis neoantes & parents of neonates that do not speak English.

trial_design.concealment: All babies admitted to NICU are requested to enroll. All neonates recieve standard digital axilla thermometry and an additional infra-red mid-forehead reading.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Mid-forehead thermometry is quick and minimally disturbing but has not been validated in literature. Mid-forehead accuracy will be compared in neoantes versus current standard practice of digital axilla thermometry.
